abstract: Rush Limbaugh responded to Friday's deployment of American military advisers to combat the African rebels who call themselves the Lord's Resistance Army by defending the group.
snippet: Rush Limbaugh responded to Friday's deployment of American military advisers to combat the African rebels who call themselves the Lord's Resistance Army by defending the group.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: Updated | 6:02 p.m. Apparently sensing an opportunity to tarnish President Obama's standing with listeners who were unaware of the suffering caused by the African rebels who call themselves the Lord's Resistance Army, Rush Limbaugh responded to the president's deployment of 100 military advisers to combat the group in central Africa on Friday in a segment of his radio show headlined, "Obama Invades Uganda, Targets Christians."
